intro: Thunbergia petersiana, commonly known as the Petersian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
